subject: RE: [junit] Printing diagnostics when test fails
msgSnippet: Well, here s a brute force method you could use: Put your entire test method in a try/catch block, and if you catch a Throwable, then print out your data
messageBody:
Well, here's a brute force method you could use: Put your entire test
method in a try/catch block, and if you catch a Throwable, then print
out your data structure and rethrow the Throwable on up to JUnit. I'm
sure (I hope, at least) there's a more elegant way, but without reading
up on how test results and the test runner contract work, this approach
is easy and quick.


Todd.

Subject: [junit] Printing diagnostics when test fails



I'm testing a complicated data structure, and I've written a
method
that prints the structure to the console for debugging purposes.
I'd
like to have this method run automatically if and only if a test

fails. For instance, I'd like to write something like this:

@After
public void tearDown()
{
if (testFailed())
printDiagnostics();
}

Is there some way of doing that? Thanks,

Trevor
